top_categories.workout_context: 211 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Pirinexus 360's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
Pirinexus 360's mixed gravel and asphalt with volcanic zones and forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 211 miles.
11,150ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At Pirinexus 360, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
53ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 211 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
211 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 11,150ft of climbing on mixed gravel and asphalt with volcanic zones and does to your power file on race day.
11,150ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Pirinexus 360, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Pirinexus 360. Train it until it feels boring.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 211 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 211 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Pirinexus 360. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Pirinexus 360 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mixed gravel and asphalt with volcanic zones and technical border descent to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 211 miles of mixed gravel and asphalt with volcanic zones and technical border descent in Girona, Catalonia, Spain.
